rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Successful indeed are the believers,
rows.transliteration: qad aflaḥal mu-minūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى صَلَاتِهِمْ خَـٰشِعُونَ
rows.translation: Who are humble in their prayers,
rows.transliteration: alladhīna hum fī ṣalātihim khāshi`ūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنِ ٱللَّغْوِ مُعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: And who keep aloof from what is vain,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum `anillaghwi mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِلزَّكَوٰةِ فَـٰعِلُونَ
rows.translation: And who are givers of poor-rate,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum lilzzakāti fā`ilūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَـٰفِظُونَ
rows.translation: And who guard their private parts,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum lifurūjihim ḥāfiẓūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
rows.translation: Except before their mates or those whom their right hands possess, for they surely are not blameable,
rows.transliteration: illā `alā azwājihim aw mā malakat aymānuhum fa-innahum ghayru malūmīn

rows.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
rows.translation: But whoever seeks to go beyond that, these are they that exceed the limits;
rows.transliteration: famanib-taghā warā-a dhālika fa-ulā-ika humul `ādūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَـٰنَـٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ
rows.translation: And those who are keepers of their trusts and their covenant,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum li-amānātihim wa`ahdihim rā`ūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَٰتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
rows.translation: And those who keep a guard on their prayers;
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum `alā ṣalawātihim yuḥāfiẓūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
rows.translation: These are they who are the heirs,
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika humul wārithūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسَ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: Who shall inherit the Paradise; they shall abide therein.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yarithūnal firdawsa hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن سُلَـٰلَةٍ مِّن طِينٍ
rows.translation: And certainly We created man of an extract of clay,
rows.transliteration: walaqad khalaqnal-insāna min sulālatim min ṭīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ نُطْفَةً فِى قَرَارٍ مَّكِينٍ
rows.translation: Then We made him a small seed in a firm resting-place,
rows.transliteration: thumma ja`alnāhu nuṭfatan fī qarārin makīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا ٱلنُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقْنَا ٱلْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةً فَخَلَقْنَا ٱلْمُضْغَةَ عِظَـٰمًا فَكَسَوْنَا ٱلْعِظَـٰمَ لَحْمًا ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَـٰهُ خَلْقًا ءَاخَرَ ۚ فَتَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ ٱلْخَـٰلِقِينَ
rows.translation: Then We made the seed a clot, then We made the clot a lump of flesh, then We made (in) the lump of flesh bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, then We caused it to grow into another creation, so blessed be Allah, the best of the creators.
rows.transliteration: thumma khalaqnan nuṭfata `alaqatan fakhalaqnal `alaqata muḍghatan fakhalaqnal muḍghata `iẓāman fakasawnal `iẓāma laḥman thumma ansha-nāhu khalqan ākhar ۚ fatabārakallāhu aḥsanul khāliqīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ
rows.translation: Then after that you will most surely die.
rows.transliteration: thumma innakum ba`da dhālika lamayyitūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ تُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: Then surely on the day of resurrection you shall be raised.
rows.transliteration: thumma innakum yawmal qiyāmati tub`athūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَآئِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ ٱلْخَلْقِ غَـٰفِلِينَ
rows.translation: And certainly We made above you seven heavens; and never are We heedless of creation.
rows.transliteration: walaqad khalaqnā fawqakum sab`a ṭarā-iqa wa mā kunnā `anil khalqi ghāfilīn

rows.arabic: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍ فَأَسْكَنَّـٰهُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابٍۭ بِهِۦ لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
rows.translation: And We send down water from the cloud according to a measure, then We cause it to settle in the earth, and most surely We are able to carry it away.
rows.transliteration: wa-anzalnā minas samā-i mā-an biqadarin fa-askannāhu fil-arḍ ۖ wa innā `alā dhahābin bihi laqādirūn

rows.arabic: فَأَنشَأْنَا لَكُم بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍ مِّن نَّخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍ لَّكُمْ فِيهَا فَوَٰكِهُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: Then We cause to grow thereby gardens of palm trees and grapes for you; you have in them many fruits and from them do you eat;
rows.transliteration: fa-ansha-nā lakum bihi jannātin min nakhīlin wa-a`nābin lakum fīhā fawākihu kathīratun wa minhā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: وَشَجَرَةً تَخْرُجُ مِن طُورِ سَيْنَآءَ تَنۢبُتُ بِٱلدُّهْنِ وَصِبْغٍ لِّلْـَٔاكِلِينَ
rows.translation: And a tree that grows out of Mount Sinai which produces oil and a condiment for those who eat.
rows.transliteration: washajaratan takhruju min ṭūri saynā-a tanbutu bid duhni waṣibghin lil-ākilīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ لَعِبْرَةً ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِى بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: And most surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We make you to drink of what is in their bellies, and you have in them many advantages and of them you eat,
rows.transliteration: wa inna lakum fil-an`āmi la`ibrah ۖ nusqīkum mimmā fī buṭūnihā walakum fīhā manāfi`u kathīratun wa minhā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And on them and on the ships you are borne.
rows.transliteration: wa`alayhā wa`alal-fulki tuḥmalūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: And certainly We sent Nuh to his people, and he said: O my people! serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; will you not then guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi faqāla yāqawmi'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruh ۖ afalā tattaqūn

rows.arabic: فَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُرِيدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلَـٰٓئِكَةً مَّا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِىٓ ءَابَآئِنَا ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: And the chiefs of those who disbelieved from among his people said: He is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who desires that he may have superiority over you, and if Allah had pleased, He could certainly have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our fathers of yore:
rows.transliteration: faqālal-mala-ul ladhīna kafarū min qawmihi mā hādhā illā basharun mithlukum yurīdu an yatafaḍḍala `alaykum walaw shā-allāhu la-anzala malā-ikatan mā sami`nā bihādhā fī ābā-inal-awwalīn

rows.arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌۢ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: He is only a madman, so bear with him for a time.
rows.transliteration: in huwa illā rajulun bihi jinnatun fatarabbaṣū bihi ḥattā ḥīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
rows.translation: He said: O my Lord! help me against their calling me a liar.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbin-ṣurnī bimā kadhhabūn

rows.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ أَنِ ٱصْنَعِ ٱلْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ ۙ فَٱسْلُكْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَوْلُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبْنِى فِى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ
rows.translation: So We revealed to him, saying: Make the ark before Our eyes and (according to) Our revelation; and when Our command is given and the valley overflows, take into it of every kind a pair, two, and your followers, except those among them against whom the word has gone forth, and do not speak to Me in respect of those who are unjust; surely they shall be drowned.
rows.transliteration: fa-awḥaynā ilayhi aniṣ-na`il fulka bi-a`yuninā wawaḥyinā fa-idhā jā-a amrunā wafārat tannūru fasluk fīhā min kullin zawjaynith-nayni wa-ahlaka illā man sabaqa `alayhil qawlu minhum ۖ walā tukhāṭibnī fil ladhīna ẓalamū ۖ innahum mughraqūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱسْتَوَيْتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَّعَكَ عَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ فَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى نَجَّىٰنَا مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And when you are firmly seated, you and those with you, in the ark, say: All praise is due to Allah who delivered us from the unjust people:
rows.transliteration: fa-idhas-tawayta anta wa man ma`aka `alal-fulki faqulil ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī najjānā minal qawmiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَنزِلْنِى مُنزَلًا مُّبَارَكًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْمُنزِلِينَ
rows.translation: And say: O my Lord! cause me to disembark a blessed alighting, and Thou art the best to cause to alight.
rows.transliteration: waqul rabbi anzilnī munzalan mubārakan wa-anta khayrul munzilīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ وَإِن كُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there are signs in this, and most surely We are ever trying (men).
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyātin wa in kunnā lamubtalīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا ءَاخَرِينَ
rows.translation: Then We raised up after them another generation.
rows.transliteration: thumma ansha-nā min ba`dihim qarnan ākharīn

rows.arabic: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِّنْهُمْ أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: So We sent among them an apostle from among them, saying: Serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; will you not then guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: fa-arsalnā fīhim rasūlan minhum ani'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruh ۖ afalā tattaqūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِلِقَآءِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَتْرَفْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يَأْكُلُ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ مِنْهُ وَيَشْرَبُ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ
rows.translation: And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and called the meeting of the hereafter a lie, and whom We had given plenty to enjoy in this world's life, said: This is nothing but a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat from and drinking of what you drink.
rows.transliteration: waqālal-mala-u min qawmihil ladhīna kafarū wakadhhabū biliqā-il-ākhirati wa-atrafnāhum fil ḥayātid dunyā mā hādhā illā basharun mithlukum ya-kulu mimmā ta-kulūna minhu wayashrabu mimmā tashrabūn

rows.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُم بَشَرًا مِّثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: And if you obey a mortal like yourselves, then most surely you will be losers:
rows.transliteration: wala-in aṭa`tum basharan mithlakum innakum idhal lakhāsirūn

rows.arabic: أَيَعِدُكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ إِذَا مِتُّمْ وَكُنتُمْ تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَنَّكُم مُّخْرَجُونَ
rows.translation: What! does he threaten you that when you are dead and become dust and bones that you shall then be brought forth?
rows.transliteration: aya`idukum annakum idhā mittum wakuntum turāban wa`iẓāman annakum mukhrajūn

rows.arabic: هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ
rows.translation: Far, far is that which you are threatened with.
rows.transliteration: hayhāta hayhāta limā tū`adūn

rows.arabic: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا ٱلدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ
rows.translation: There is naught but our life in this world; we die and we live and we shall not be raised again.
rows.transliteration: in hiya illā ḥayātunad dunyā namūtu wanaḥyā wa mā naḥnu bimab`ūthīn

rows.arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَمَا نَحْنُ لَهُۥ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: He is naught but a man who has forged a lie against Allah, and we are not going to believe in him.
rows.transliteration: in huwa illā rajulunif-tarā `alallāhi kadhiban wa mā naḥnu lahu bimu-minīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
rows.translation: He said: O my Lord! help me against their calling me a liar.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbin-ṣurnī bimā kadhhabūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٍ لَّيُصْبِحُنَّ نَـٰدِمِينَ
rows.translation: He said: In a little while they will most certainly be repenting.
rows.transliteration: qāla `ammā qalīlin layuṣbiḥunna nādimīn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ غُثَآءً ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: So the punishment overtook them in justice, and We made them as rubbish; so away with the unjust people.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhat-humuṣ ṣayḥatu bil ḥaqqi faja`alnāhum ghuthā-ā ۚ fabu`dal lilqawmiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ قُرُونًا ءَاخَرِينَ
rows.translation: Then We raised after them other generations.
rows.transliteration: thumma ansha-nā min ba`dihim qurūnan ākharīn

rows.arabic: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
rows.translation: No people can hasten on their doom nor can they postpone (it).
rows.transliteration: mā tasbiqu min ummatin ajalahā wa mā yasta-khirūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتْرَا ۖ كُلَّ مَا جَآءَ أُمَّةً رَّسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُ ۚ فَأَتْبَعْنَا بَعْضَهُم بَعْضًا وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِّقَوْمٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Then We sent Our apostles one after another; whenever there came to a people their apostle, they called him a liar, so We made some of them follow others and We made them stories; so away with a people who do not believe!
rows.transliteration: thumma arsalnā rusulanā tatrā ۖ kulla mā jā-a ummatan rasūluhā kadhhabūh ۚ fa-atba`nā ba`ḍahum ba`ḍan waja`alnāhum aḥādīth ۚ fabu`dal liqawmin lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: Then We sent Musa and his brother Haroun, with Our communications and a clear authority,
rows.transliteration: thumma arsalnā mūsā wa-akhāhu hārūna bi-āyātinā wasulṭānin mubīn

rows.arabic: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا عَالِينَ
rows.translation: To Firon and his chiefs, but they behaved haughtily and they were an insolent people.
rows.transliteration: ilā fir`awna wa mala-ihi fastakbarū wakānū qawman `ālīn

rows.arabic: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَـٰبِدُونَ
rows.translation: And they said: What! shall we believe in two mortals like ourselves while their people serve us?
rows.transliteration: faqālū anu-minu libasharayni mithlinā waqawmuhumā lanā `ābidūn

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُهْلَكِينَ
rows.translation: So they rejected them and became of those who were destroyed.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhumā fakānū minal muhlakīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And certainly We gave Musa the Book that they may follow a right direction.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ātaynā mūsal kitāba la`allahum yahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُۥٓ ءَايَةً وَءَاوَيْنَـٰهُمَآ إِلَىٰ رَبْوَةٍ ذَاتِ قَرَارٍ وَمَعِينٍ
rows.translation: And We made the son of Marium and his mother a sign, and We gave them a shelter on a lofty ground having meadows and springs.
rows.transliteration: waja`alnab-na maryama wa-ummahu āyatan wa-āwaynāhumā ilā rabwatin dhāti qarārin wa ma`īn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلرُّسُلُ كُلُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَٱعْمَلُوا۟ صَـٰلِحًا ۖ إِنِّى بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: O apostles! eat of the good things and do good; surely I know what you do.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhar rusulu kulū minaṭ ṭayyibāti wa`malū ṣāliḥā ۖ innī bimā ta`malūna `alīm

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَٰحِدَةً وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱتَّقُونِ
rows.translation: And surely this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, therefore be careful (of your duty) to Me.
rows.transliteration: wa inna hādhihi ummatukum ummatan wāḥidatan wa-ana rabbukum fattaqūn

rows.arabic: فَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍۭ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
rows.translation: But they cut off their religion among themselves into sects, each part rejoicing in that which is with them.
rows.transliteration: fataqaṭṭa`ū amrahum baynahum zuburā ۖ kullu ḥizbin bimā ladayhim fariḥūn

rows.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ فِى غَمْرَتِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: Therefore leave them in their overwhelming ignorance till
rows.transliteration: fadharhum fī ghamratihim ḥattā ḥīn

rows.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُم بِهِۦ مِن مَّالٍ وَبَنِينَ
rows.translation: Do they think that by what We aid them with of wealth and children,
rows.transliteration: ayaḥsabūna annamā numidduhum bihi min mālin wabanīn

rows.arabic: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ ۚ بَل لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: We are hastening to them of good things? Nay, they do not perceive.
rows.transliteration: nusāri`u lahum fil khayrāt ۚ bal lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ خَشْيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
rows.translation: Surely they who from fear of their Lord are cautious,
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna hum min khashyati rabbihim mushfiqūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: And those who believe in the communications of their Lord,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum bi-āyāti rabbihim yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِرَبِّهِمْ لَا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: And those who do not associate (aught) with their Lord,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum birabbihim lā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْتُونَ مَآ ءَاتَوا۟ وَّقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ رَٰجِعُونَ
rows.translation: And those who give what they give (in alms) while their hearts are full of fear that to their Lord they must return,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yu-tūna mā ātaw waqulūbuhum wajilatun annahum ilā rabbihim rāji`ūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَهُمْ لَهَا سَـٰبِقُونَ
rows.translation: These hasten to good things and they are foremost in (attaining) them.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika yusāri`ūna fil khayrāti wahum lahā sābiqūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَلَدَيْنَا كِتَـٰبٌ يَنطِقُ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And We do not lay on any soul a burden except to the extent of its ability, and with Us is a book which speaks the truth, and they shall not be dealt with unjustly.
rows.transliteration: walā nukallifu nafsan illā wus`ahā ۖ waladaynā kitābun yanṭiqu bil ḥaqq ۚ wahum lā yuẓlamūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلٌ مِّن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمْ لَهَا عَـٰمِلُونَ
rows.translation: Nay, their hearts are in overwhelming ignorance with respect to it and they have besides this other deeds which they do.
rows.transliteration: bal qulūbuhum fī ghamratim min hādhā walahum a`mālun min dūni dhālika hum lahā `āmilūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِم بِٱلْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْـَٔرُونَ
rows.translation: Until when We overtake those who lead easy lives among them with punishment, lo! they cry for succor.
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā akhadhnā mutrafīhim bil `adhābi idhā hum yaj-arūn

rows.arabic: لَا تَجْـَٔرُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّكُم مِّنَّا لَا تُنصَرُونَ
rows.translation: Cry not for succor this day; surely you shall not be given help from Us.
rows.transliteration: lā taj-arul yawm ۖ innakum minnā lā tunṣarūn

rows.arabic: قَدْ كَانَتْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ تَنكِصُونَ
rows.translation: My communications were indeed recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels,
rows.transliteration: qad kānat āyātī tutlā `alaykum fakuntum `alā a`qābikum tankiṣūn

rows.arabic: مُسْتَكْبِرِينَ بِهِۦ سَـٰمِرًا تَهْجُرُونَ
rows.translation: In arrogance; talking nonsense about the Quran, and left him like one telling fables by night.
rows.transliteration: mustakbirīna bihi sāmiran tahjurūn

rows.arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَدَّبَّرُوا۟ ٱلْقَوْلَ أَمْ جَآءَهُم مَّا لَمْ يَأْتِ ءَابَآءَهُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Is it then that they do not ponder over what is said, or is it that there has come to them that which did not come to their fathers of old?
rows.transliteration: afalam yaddabbarul qawla am jā-ahum mā lam ya-ti ābā-ahumul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِفُوا۟ رَسُولَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
rows.translation: Or is it that they have not recognized their Apostle, so that they deny him?
rows.transliteration: am lam ya`rifū rasūlahum fahum lahu munkirūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۢ ۚ بَلْ جَآءَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
rows.translation: Or do they say: There is madness in him? Nay! he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse from the truth.
rows.transliteration: am yaqūlūna bihi jinnah ۚ bal jā-ahum bil ḥaqqi wa-aktharuhum lilḥaqqi kārihūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْحَقُّ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ لَفَسَدَتِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّ ۚ بَلْ أَتَيْنَـٰهُم بِذِكْرِهِمْ فَهُمْ عَن ذِكْرِهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: And should the truth follow their low desires, surely the heavens and the earth and all those who are therein would have perished. Nay! We have brought to them their reminder, but from their reminder they turn aside.
rows.transliteration: walawit-taba`al ḥaqqu ahwā-ahum lafasadatis samāwātu wal-arḍu wa man fīhinn ۚ bal ataynāhum bidhikrihim fahum `an dhikrihim mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ خَرْجًا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
rows.translation: Or is it that you ask them a recompense? But the recompense of your Lord is best, and He is the best of those who provide sustenance.
rows.transliteration: am tas-aluhum kharjan fakharāju rabbika khayr ۖ wahuwa khayrur rāziqīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: And most surely you invite them to a right way.
rows.transliteration: wa innaka latad`ūhum ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ عَنِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ لَنَـٰكِبُونَ
rows.translation: And most surely those who do not believe in the hereafter are deviating from the way.
rows.transliteration: wa innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati `aniṣ ṣirāṭi lanākibūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ رَحِمْنَـٰهُمْ وَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِم مِّن ضُرٍّ لَّلَجُّوا۟ فِى طُغْيَـٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
rows.translation: And if We show mercy to them and remove the distress they have, they would persist in their inordinacy, blindly wandering on.
rows.transliteration: walaw raḥimnāhum wakashafnā mā bihim min ḍurrin lalajjū fī ṭughyānihim ya`mahūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْعَذَابِ فَمَا ٱسْتَكَانُوا۟ لِرَبِّهِمْ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
rows.translation: And already We overtook them with chastisement, but they were not submissive to their Lord, nor do they humble themselves.
rows.transliteration: walaqad akhadhnāhum bil `adhābi famas-takānū lirabbihim wa mā yataḍarra`ūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا ذَا عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
rows.translation: Until when We open upon them a door of severe chastisement, lo! they are in despair at it.
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā fataḥnā `alayhim bāban dhā `adhābin shadīdin idhā hum fīhi mublisūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: And He it is Who made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts; little is it that you give thanks.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī ansha-a lakumus sam`a wal-abṣāra wal-af-idah ۚ qalīlan mā tashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
rows.translation: And He it is Who multiplied you in the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī dhara-akum fil-arḍi wa ilayhi tuḥsharūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ ٱخْتِلَـٰفُ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: And He it is Who gives life and causes death, and (in) His (control) is the alternation of the night and the day; do you not then understand?
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī yuḥyī wayumītu walahukh-tilāful layli wan nahār ۚ afalā ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ قَالُوا۟ مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
rows.translation: Nay, they say the like of what the ancients said:
rows.transliteration: bal qālū mithla mā qālal-awwalūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
rows.translation: They say: What! When we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we then be raised?
rows.transliteration: qālū a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا هَـٰذَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly we are promised this, and (so were) our fathers aforetime; this is naught but stories of those of old.
rows.transliteration: laqad wu`idnā naḥnu wa-ābā-unā hādhā min qablu in hādhā illā asāṭīrul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: قُل لِّمَنِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهَآ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Say: Whose is the earth, and whoever is therein, if you know?
rows.transliteration: qul limanil-arḍu wa man fīhā in kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: They will say: Allah's. Say: Will you not then mind?
rows.transliteration: sayaqūlūna lillāh ۚ qul afalā tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ ٱلسَّبْعِ وَرَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: Say: Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty dominion?
rows.transliteration: qul man rabbus samāwātis sab`i warabbul `arshil `aẓīm

rows.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: They will say: (This is) Allah's. Say: Will you not then guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: sayaqūlūna lillāh ۚ qul afalā tattaqūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَنۢ بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيْهِ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Say: Who is it in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things and Who gives succor, but against Him Succor is not given, if you do but know?
rows.transliteration: qul man biyadihi malakūtu kulli shay-in wahuwa yujīru walā yujāru `alayhi in kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسْحَرُونَ
rows.translation: They will say: (This is) Allah's. Say: From whence are you then deceived?
rows.transliteration: sayaqūlūna lillāh ۚ qul fa-annā tus-ḥarūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ أَتَيْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
rows.translation: Nay! We have brought to them the truth, and most surely they are liars.
rows.transliteration: bal ataynāhum bil ḥaqqi wa innahum lakādhibūn

rows.arabic: مَا ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُۥ مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ ۚ إِذًا لَّذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَـٰهٍۭ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: Never did Allah take to Himself a son, and never was there with him any (other) god-- in that case would each god have certainly taken away what he created, and some of them would certainly have overpowered others; glory be to Allah above what they describe!
rows.transliteration: mat-takhadhallāhu min waladin wa mā kāna ma`ahu min ilāh ۚ idhal ladhahaba kullu ilāhin bimā khalaqa wala`alā ba`ḍuhum `alā ba`ḍ ۚ subḥānallāhi `ammā yaṣifūn

rows.arabic: عَـٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ فَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: The Knower of the unseen and the seen, so may He be exalted above what they associate (with Him).
rows.transliteration: `ālimil ghaybi wash shahādati fata`ālā `ammā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: قُل رَّبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّى مَا يُوعَدُونَ
rows.translation: Say: O my Lord! if Thou shouldst make me see what they are threatened with:
rows.transliteration: qul rabbi immā turiyannī mā yū`adūn

rows.arabic: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِى فِى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: My Lord! then place me not with the unjust.
rows.transliteration: rabbi falā taj`alnī fil qawmiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمْ لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
rows.translation: And most surely We are well able to make you see what We threaten them with.
rows.transliteration: wa innā `alā an nuriyaka mā na`iduhum laqādirūn

rows.arabic: ٱدْفَعْ بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ ۚ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: Repel evil by what is best; We know best what they describe.
rows.transliteration: id-fa` bil latī hiya aḥsanus sayyi-ah ۚ naḥnu a`lamu bimā yaṣifūn

rows.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَٰتِ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينِ
rows.translation: And say: O my Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from the evil suggestions of the Shaitans;
rows.transliteration: waqul rabbi a`ūdhu bika min hamazātish shayāṭīn

rows.arabic: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَن يَحْضُرُونِ
rows.translation: And I seek refuge in Thee! O my Lord! from their presence.
rows.transliteration: wa-a`ūdhu bika rabbi an yaḥḍurūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ٱرْجِعُونِ
rows.translation: Until when death overtakes one of them, he says: Send me back, my Lord, send me back;
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā jā-a aḥadahumul mawtu qāla rabbir-ji`ūn

rows.arabic: لَعَلِّىٓ أَعْمَلُ صَـٰلِحًا فِيمَا تَرَكْتُ ۚ كَلَّآ ۚ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَآئِلُهَا ۖ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِم بَرْزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: Haply I may do good in that which I have left. By no means! it is a (mere) word that he speaks; and before them is a barrier until the day they are raised.
rows.transliteration: la`allī a`malu ṣāliḥan fīmā tarakt ۚ kallā ۚ innahā kalimatun huwa qā-iluhā ۖ wa min warā-ihim barzakhun ilā yawmi yub`athūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَلَآ أَنسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَلَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
rows.translation: So when the trumpet is blown, there shall be no ties of relationship between them on that day, nor shall they ask of each other.
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā nufikha fiṣ ṣūri falā ansāba baynahum yawma-idhin walā yatasā-alūn

rows.arabic: فَمَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Then as for him whose good deeds are preponderant, these are the successful.
rows.transliteration: faman thaqulat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

rows.arabic: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فِى جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: And as for him whose good deeds are light, these are they who shall have lost their souls, abiding in hell
rows.transliteration: wa man khaffat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā-ikal ladhīna khasirū anfusahum fī jahannama khālidūn

rows.arabic: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَـٰلِحُونَ
rows.translation: The fire shall scorch their faces, and they therein shall be in severe affliction.
rows.transliteration: talfaḥu wujūhahumun nāru wahum fīhā kāliḥūn

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
rows.translation: Were not My communications recited to you? But you used to reject them.
rows.transliteration: alam takun āyātī tutlā `alaykum fakuntum bihā tukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًا ضَآلِّينَ
rows.translation: They shall say: O our Lord! our adversity overcame us and we were an erring people:
rows.transliteration: qālū rabbanā ghalabat `alaynā shiqwatunā wakunnā qawman ḍāllīn

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: O our Lord! Take us out of it; then if we return (to evil) surely we shall be unjust.
rows.transliteration: rabbanā akhrijnā minhā fa-in `udnā fa-innā ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱخْسَـُٔوا۟ فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ
rows.translation: He shall say: Go away into it and speak not to Me;
rows.transliteration: qālakh-sa-ū fīhā walā tukallimūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْ عِبَادِى يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
rows.translation: Surely there was a party of My servants who said: O our Lord! we believe, so do Thou forgive us and have mercy on us, and Thou art the best of the Merciful ones.
rows.transliteration: innahu kāna farīqun min `ibādī yaqūlūna rabbanā āmannā faghfir lanā warḥamnā wa-anta khayrur rāḥimīn

rows.arabic: فَٱتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰٓ أَنسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِى وَكُنتُم مِّنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ
rows.translation: But you took them for a mockery until they made you forget My remembrance and you used to laugh at them.
rows.transliteration: fattakhadhtumūhum sikhriyyan ḥattā ansawkum dhikrī wakuntum minhum taḍ-ḥakūn

rows.arabic: إِنِّى جَزَيْتُهُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلْفَآئِزُونَ
rows.translation: Surely I have rewarded them this day because they were patient, that they are the achievers.
rows.transliteration: innī jazaytuhumul yawma bimā ṣabarū annahum humul fā-izūn

rows.arabic: قَـٰلَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
rows.translation: He will say: How many years did you tarry in the earth?
rows.transliteration: qāla kam labithtum fil-arḍi `adada sinīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَسْـَٔلِ ٱلْعَآدِّينَ
rows.translation: They will say: We tarried a day or part of a day, but ask those who keep account.
rows.transliteration: qālū labithnā yawman aw ba`ḍa yawmin fas-alil `āddīn

rows.arabic: قَـٰلَ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ لَّوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: He will say: You did tarry but a little-- had you but known (it):
rows.transliteration: qāla in labithtum illā qalīlā ۖ law annakum kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: What! did you then think that We had created you in vain and that you shall not be returned to Us?
rows.transliteration: afaḥasibtum annamā khalaqnākum `abathan wa-annakum ilaynā lā turja`ūn

rows.arabic: فَتَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
rows.translation: So exalted be Allah, the True King; no god is there but He, the Lord of the honorable dominion.
rows.transliteration: fata`ālallāhul malikul ḥaqq ۖ lā ilāha illā huwa rabbul `arshil karīm

rows.arabic: وَمَن يَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ لَا بُرْهَـٰنَ لَهُۥ بِهِۦ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: And whoever invokes with Allah another god-- he has no proof of this-- his reckoning is only with his Lord; surely the unbelievers shall not be successful.
rows.transliteration: wa man yad`u ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhara lā burhāna lahu bihi fa-innamā ḥisābuhu `inda rabbih ۚ innahu lā yufliḥul kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ وَٱرْحَمْ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
rows.translation: And say: O my Lord! forgive and have mercy, and Thou art the best of the Merciful ones.
rows.transliteration: waqul rabbigh-fir warḥam wa-anta khayrur rāḥimīn
